page.title: 19Tourism in S'key & C'thorpe.
page.content:
Norfolk light and landscape have attracted artists; writers have also been drawn by the villages themselves. Historically the marsh and downlands have always been important because while open to invasion from the sea they are, at the same time, capable of being defended from strong points. It is this, it is said, which has bred a spirit of independence which keeps unwelcome intruders at arms' length.
The increasing fame of the coastland {flora}and{fauna}as well as the natural beauty of the landscape are bringing more tourists and campers (no caravan sites are permitted). Usually these are made welcome, sometimes as friends, but it is at Christmas, when the tourists are gone and the harvest is home that the villages really come to life.
